intro: Rubus senticosus var. pusillus, commonly known as the small thimbleberry, is a shrub native to the Pacific Northwest of North America. It belongs to the Rosaceae family and is characterized by its small, edible berries that are typically yellow or red when ripe. The plant has compound leaves with serrated edges and produces clusters of white flowers in the spring. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. The berries are used in local cuisines and have traditional medicinal uses among Indigenous communities.
